Class Team

  • java.lang.Object
    • Team

  • public class Team
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for the Hero Team with which the User interacts with the game. This class provides all the attributes for team such as Team Name, Size, Gold, Inventory and ArrayList Ward for when Heros are being healed. The class also contains methods to edit the aforementioned attributes and other methods. (Eg. Checking whether a Hero is dead)
    Author:
    Sachin Sakthivel and Sasiru Goonatillake Date: May 3rd 2018

    • Constructor Detail

      • Team

        public Team​(java.lang.String name,
            int length)
        Constructor method for Team class. Team Name is set using String input 'name' and Team Size is determined by Integer input 'length'. A default sum of 300 gold is given to Team upon creation. The inventory is setup with all the Items with 0 Stock.
        Parameters:
        name - Input String variable which determines Team Name.
        length - Input Integer variable which determines Team Size.

    • Method Detail

      • setInventory

        public void setInventory​()
        This method Sets up the inventory for Team with each Items stock set to 0 and adding each Item stock to Integer ArrayList 'invList'.

      • getInv

        public java.util.ArrayList<Item> getInv​()
        This method returns the Integer ArrayList 'invList' which contains data about the Team's Inventory.
        Returns:
        Returns the Integer ArrayList 'invList'

      • setInv

        public void setInv​(java.util.ArrayList<Item> updateInv)
        This method replaces the current 'invList' with an updated Team Inventory using input ArrayList variable 'updateInv' which contains Items.
        Parameters:
        updateInv - Input ArrayList variable 'updateInv'which contains Items is an updated Team Inventory.

      • getteamName

        public java.lang.String getteamName​()
        This method returns the Team Name.
        Returns:
        Returns String variable 'teamName'

      • getTeam

        public java.util.ArrayList<Hero> getTeam​()
        This method returns the ArrayList Team, containing active Heroes.
        Returns:
        Returns the ArrayList Team which contains active Heroes.

      • addToTeam

        public void addToTeam​(Hero superhero)
        This method adds Hero type variable 'superhero' to team if the Team doesnt already contain the same Hero.
        Parameters:
        superhero - Hero type variable 'superhero', which is a new Hero being added to the Team.

      • removeOffTeam

        public void removeOffTeam​(Hero superhero)
        Removing a Hero from Team when killed. This method removes Hero type variable 'superhero' from team and adds 'superhero' to the ArrayList containing Heroes Graveyard.
        Parameters:
        superhero - Hero type variable 'superhero', which is a new Hero being removed from the Team.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • checkDead

        public boolean checkDead​(GameEnvironment game)
        This method Checks whether the Team is dead in which case the User has been deefated by the Game. It checks whether Team and Ward has any Heroes and if not returns true, else false.
        Parameters:
        game - Input variable 'game' of type GameEnviornment, to update data about the Team.
        Returns:
        Returns True if no Heroes in Team or Ward, else returns false.

      • typeCheck

        public boolean typeCheck​(java.lang.String type)
        This method checks the Team whether a certain type of Hero is present in Team, to activate especial abilities.
        Parameters:
        type - Input variable 'type' of Hero Type which is the Hero Type the Game is looking for.
        Returns:
        Returns true if Hero Type is found, else returns false.

      • nameCheck

        public boolean nameCheck​(java.lang.String name)
        This method checks the Team whether a certain Name is already taken by a Hero in Team, to avoid Name conflicts between Heroes.
        Parameters:
        name - Input variable 'name' of type String which is a Name of a Hero.
        Returns:
        Returns true if a Hero in Team already has the 'name', else returns false.

      • getCoins

        public int getCoins​()
        This method returns the amount of Gold the Team currently has.
        Returns:
        Returns Integer variable 'Coins' which is the amount of Gold the Team currently has.

      • setCoins

        public void setCoins​(int coins)
        This method updates the Team's Gold based on the Integer input 'coins'.
        Parameters:
        coins - Integer input 'coins' updates Team's Gold.

      • moveToWard

        public void moveToWard​(Hero hero)
        This method removes a Hero, input 'hero', from Team and adds 'hero' to Ward. Used when Heros are being healed in the Hospital.
        Parameters:
        hero - Input variable 'hero' of Hero type which determines which Hero is being Transfered from Team to Ward.

      • releaseFromWard

        public void releaseFromWard​(Hero hero)
        This method removes a Hero, input 'hero', from Ward and adds 'hero' to Team. Used when Heros are finished being healed in the Hospital.
        Parameters:
        hero - Input variable 'hero' of Hero type which determines which Hero is being Transfered from Ward to Team.

      • getWard

        public java.util.ArrayList<Hero> getWard​()
        This method returns the ArrayList 'Ward', containing Healing Heroes.
        Returns:
        Returns the ArrayList 'Ward' which contains Healing Heroes.

      • getGrave

        public java.util.ArrayList<Hero> getGrave​()
        This method returns the ArrayList 'Graveyard', containing Dead Heroes.
        Returns:
        Returns the ArrayList 'Graveyard' which contains Dead Heroes.

      • getTeamLength

        public int getTeamLength​()
        This method returns the size of the Team, stored in the Integer variable 'teamLength'.
        Returns:
        Returns Integer variable 'teamLength'.

      • setTeamLength

        public void setTeamLength​(int teamLength)
        This method updates the size of the team using input Integer variable 'teamLength'.
        Parameters:
        teamLength - Input Integer variable 'teamLength' which is the updated Team Size.
